verses.kjv: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
verses.ct: Wine makes you a fool, and liquor makes you wild — anyone led astray by them lacks wisdom.

verses.kjv: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
verses.ct: A king's anger is like the roar of a lion — whoever provokes him brings harm on himself.

verses.kjv: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
verses.ct: Avoiding conflict is honorable, but every fool rushes into arguments.

verses.kjv: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
verses.ct: A lazy person won't plow because it's cold, so at harvest time he'll beg and get nothing.

verses.kjv: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
verses.ct: The intentions in a person's heart are like deep water, but someone with insight can draw them out.

verses.kjv: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?
verses.ct: Many people claim to be loyal, but who can actually find someone truly trustworthy?

verses.kjv: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.
verses.ct: A righteous person lives with integrity — their children are blessed because of them.

verses.kjv: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
verses.ct: A king sitting on the judgment seat separates out all evil with his discerning gaze.

verses.kjv: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
verses.ct: Who can honestly say, 'I've purified my heart — I'm free from my sin'?

verses.kjv: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.
verses.ct: Dishonest weights and dishonest measures — the LORD despises both of them.

verses.kjv: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
verses.ct: Even a child reveals their character through their actions — whether what they do is honest and right.

verses.kjv: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
verses.ct: The ear that hears and the eye that sees — the LORD made both of them.

verses.kjv: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
verses.ct: Don't love sleep, or you'll end up poor. Stay alert, and you'll have plenty of food.

verses.kjv: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
verses.ct: 'It's worthless! It's worthless!' the buyer complains — but after walking away, he brags about the deal.

verses.kjv: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.ct: Gold exists in abundance, and rubies too, but lips that speak knowledge are the rarest treasure.

verses.kjv: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
verses.ct: Take the coat of anyone who guarantees a stranger's debt — hold it as collateral when he pledges security for an outsider.

verses.kjv: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
verses.ct: Food gained through dishonesty tastes sweet at first, but later your mouth will be full of gravel.

verses.kjv: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.
verses.ct: Plans succeed through good advice, so wage war only with wise guidance.

verses.kjv: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
verses.ct: A gossip goes around revealing secrets, so don't associate with someone who talks too freely.

verses.kjv: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
verses.ct: Whoever curses their father or mother — their light will be snuffed out in total darkness.

verses.kjv: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
verses.ct: An inheritance grabbed too quickly at the start will bring no blessing in the end.

verses.kjv: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
verses.ct: Don't say, 'I'll pay back this wrong myself.' Wait for the LORD, and he will rescue you.

verses.kjv: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
verses.ct: The LORD despises dishonest weights, and rigged scales are wrong.

verses.kjv: Man’s goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
verses.ct: A person's steps are directed by the LORD — so how can anyone fully understand their own path?

verses.kjv: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.
verses.ct: It's a trap to rashly dedicate something as holy and only think it through after making the vow.

verses.kjv: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
verses.ct: A wise king identifies the wicked and brings the crushing wheel down on them.

verses.kjv: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.
verses.ct: The human spirit is the LORD's lamp, searching the deepest parts of a person's inner being.

verses.kjv: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
verses.ct: Mercy and truth protect a king, and his throne is sustained by mercy.

verses.kjv: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the grey head.
verses.ct: The glory of young men is their strength, and the dignity of the elderly is their gray hair.

verses.kjv: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
verses.ct: Painful wounds scrub away evil, and beatings cleanse the deepest parts of a person's inner being.
